H0.text: Who conceived the effective communication theory 'Three Modes of Persuasion' (comprising Logos, Ethos and Pathos). Plato

H1.text: Who conceived the effective communication theory 'Three Modes of Persuasion' (comprising Logos, Ethos and Pathos). Cicero

H2.text: Who conceived the effective communication theory 'Three Modes of Persuasion' (comprising Logos, Ethos and Pathos). Quintilian

H3.text: Who conceived the effective communication theory 'Three Modes of Persuasion' (comprising Logos, Ethos and Pathos). Aristole

A4.text: Aristotle's Rhetoric proposes that a speaker can use three basic kinds of appeals to persuade his audience: ethos (an appeal to the speaker's character), pathos (an appeal to the audience's emotion), and logos (an appeal to logical reasoning).
